activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:26 PM Defendant Amir Zaki Terrell in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy in court for Amir Zaki Terrell.  Attorney Richard Jay Sullivan in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Court orders presentence investigation.  Bond revoked.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:57 PM Defendant Amir Zaki Terrell appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Amir Zaki Terrell.  Prosecuting attorney David Zarwell in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Calendar call on September 23, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Activity: Arraignment

03:49 PM Defendant Amir Zaki Terrell in court by video in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set.

Activity: Waiver of Preliminary Hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

3:00 PM Defendant Amir Zaki Terrell in court in custody by video with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy by video.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing Requested by zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:06 PM Defendant Amir Zaki Terrell in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy by video. Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Bond to continue.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:13 PM Defendant Amir Zaki Terrell in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders and intern Olivia Long by video. Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim K.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Possess no weapons including a firearm. Matter continued for public defender to appoint counsel. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 3PM.
